response: "I can't escape this constant pressure to be perfect. It's suffocating me."
"I feel like I'm losing my mind. Society's expectations are driving me crazy."
"Why can't I just be myself without fearing judgment from others?"
"Everyone seems so put together, but inside, I'm falling apart."
"I don't even know what 'perfect' means anymore. It's all so confusing."
"I'm tired of pretending. I just want to break free from this never-ending cycle."
"The more I strive for perfection, the more lost I feel. Is it even worth it?"
"I'm beginning to question whether anyone truly has it all figured out."
"I'm caught in this chaotic web of expectations, and I don't know how to escape."
"I just want to be accepted for who I am, imperfections and all. Is that too much to ask?"
